page.title: 17HOUSING 1
page.content: There is quite a variety of housing in the area although few houses are older than this century. {Chadwell}has many 1920's style council houses near Riverview,then a post-war development around Herringham School,plus 60's housing around the Tower blocks.The town houses near the old peoples' home won {a design award}in the early 70's. Many of the {Council Houses}in Chadwell are now privately owned and well-maintained. The older ones have been up-dated and have much larger gardens then the newer houses. The same is true of{Tilbury}to a certain extent. The housing around Melba Gardens is rather drab and not so well-cared for,although Thurrock U.D.C. has painted and renovated those facing Feenan Highway.Around Manor School the houses are in poor repair.
